Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
The date class helps with verifying that a given date is accurate (not too old and not an impossibly made up one).
Author:
Nida Ansari, Cecelia Chollette-Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int day  
    private int month  
    private int year  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Date()
    This constructor returns todayâ€™s date and also helps with checking if the given published date of a book is any later than the current (which shouldn't be possible).
    Date​(java.lang.String date)
    This method is taking a string in mm/dd/yyyy and creates a Date object that the user can input in a similar format.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String datetoString()
    This method obtains the month, day an year variables of a date and returns a string variable to be processed and compared.
    int getDay()
    Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's day.
    int getMonth()
    Our getter method to help obtain the int value that represents a date's month.
    int getYear()
    Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's year.
    boolean isValid()
    This method is used to help verify that the date given, which is representing when a book was published, is not imaginary/impossible or even older than books published in 1900.Returns a boolean to indicate if the published date of a book the user has inputted is valid.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    We designed the test cases to thoroughly test the isValid() method in this testbed main.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)

    • Date

      public Date()
      This constructor returns todayâ€™s date and also helps with checking if the given published date of a book is any later than the current (which shouldn't be possible).

  • Method Details

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      Our getter method to help obtain the int value that represents a date's month.
      Returns:
      the month as an integer

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's day.
      Returns:
      the day as an integer

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's year.
      Returns:
      the year as an integer

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method is used to help verify that the date given, which is representing when a book was published, is not imaginary/impossible or even older than books published in 1900.Returns a boolean to indicate if the published date of a book the user has inputted is valid.
      Returns:
      boolea true if the date not too old and realistic, false otherwise

    • datetoString

      public java.lang.String datetoString()
      This method obtains the month, day an year variables of a date and returns a string variable to be processed and compared.
      Returns:
      a string variable of the month, day and year in mm/dd/yyyy format

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      We designed the test cases to thoroughly test the isValid() method in this testbed main. The Test Specifications document will exlpain the purpose of each test case. Will each date and its respective boolean, there should either be an output that prints the given date or prints the string literal "Invalid Date!"
      Parameters:
      args - array of String argument
